fxexplainer.explainer module¶

class fxexplainer.explainer.FxExplainer(global_model_name, xtype, xnum, global_model_path, proj_name, data_path)¶

Bases: object

A FxExplainer object should be initialized with the following attributes to perform the logical explanation

Parameters

  • global_model_name (str) – The name of the black-box global model, currently support 2 models, ‘LR’ for Logistic Regression and ‘RF’ for Random Forest

  • xtype (str) – Explanation type, currently support 2 types, ‘abd’ for Abductive Explanation and ‘con’ for Concretive Explanation

  • xnum (int) – Number of explanations to be generated for each instance

  • global_model_path (str) – Path to the global model file in .pkl format trained by the sklearn library

  • proj_name (str) – Project name

  • data_path (str) – Path to the data files required for the FxExplainer

explain()¶

Main function to perform the logical explanation
